title.narrative: Provision of protection services for conflict-affected displaced and non displaced populations in Herat, Ghor and Badghis Provinces, western Afghanistan

description.narrative: Through this project, CRDSA provides protection services for 34,700 conflict- affected displaced and non-displaced population (6850 men, 10685 women, 8360 boys and 8805 girls) 60% IDP, 40% HC in Herat, Badghis and Ghor provinces The project contains 2 components including 1- Child protection services for 20900 populations including 4250 men, 3350 women, 7160 boys and 6140 girls in 9 districts of 3 targeted provinces of Herat, Badghis and Ghor 2- GBV services for 13800 populations including 2600 men, 7335 women, 1200 boys and 2665 girls in 8 provincial districts of Herat, Badghis and Ghor provinces The project has been designed according to CRDSA assessment with support and recommendation of government departments (DoRR, DoLSAMD as well as HRP 2020 and AHF 1st Standard Allocation 2020 requirements. Through this project a total of 14000 people (including 2850 men, 4570 women 2985 boys and 3595 girls) in Herat, 12650 people ( including 2250 men, 3970 women, 3435 boys and 2995 girls) in Badghis, and 8050 people ( including 1750 men, 2145 women, 1940 boys and 2215 girls) in Ghor will be benefited from GBV and CP services in 9 districts including Shindand, Pahstoon Zarghoon and Karokh in Herat, Qades, Moqur and Qala e now in Badghis as well as Firoozkoh, Dowlatyar and newly established Morghab district in Ghor province, western Afghanistan. The GBV prevention and response will focus on community dialogues regarding GBV awareness, response and prevention (for 7000 people -4500 male and 3500 female) , 4 outreach/mobile PSS (for 2500 people- 100 male, 2400 female) , health, legal and PSS counseling in 2 Women Friendly Health Spaces one in Herat and one in Badghis (for 4000 people), GBV case management and referral (for 300 people) as well as distribution of dignity kits to 3000 GBV survivors including 2220 kits for women and 780 kits for girls( female). GBV 13800 beneficiaries Including 6100 beneficiaries in Herat ( 1200 men, 3270 women, 400 boys and 1230 girls) , 5100 beneficiaries in Badghis ( including 700 men, 2870 women, 500 boys and 1030 girls) and 2600 beneficiaries in Ghor province (including 700 men, 1192 women, 300 boys and 405 girls) will be benefited from GBV awareness and response activities The child protection sub-component will provides child rights and PSS support sessions, CFSs, PSS and case management and referral services for 20900 persons (4250 men, 3350 women, 7160 boys and 6140 girls). A total of 9000 children and their parents/caregivers will receive child rights and PSS support sessions in their homes and communities. necessary actions will be taken to prevent the COVID 19 disease during the sessions, providing child-friendly spaces to 7500 children to minimize the effects of the emergency on their psycho social well-being and development through establishment of 35 CFSs (150 children age 7-18 years per CFS into three shifts) and 5 child friendly schools as well as provision of PSS counseling for 4000 shock affected children and provision of case management/referral services to 400 children who need specialized services
